alert.note: Alert for Chilton; Dallas; Perry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:34PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Chilton, northeastern Perry and northeastern Dallas Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 434 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Paul M Grist State Park, or 13 miles northwest of Valley Grande, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Valley Grande, Parnell, Paul M Grist State Park, Valley Creek Junction, Plantersville, Barrett Creek and Summerfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and south central Alabama.
